Tim: Bridenstein said Spacex only had to convert from cargo to crew. Boeing had to start from scratch and needed more money. His explanation.
ALSO: The failure to achieve the expected orbit could be a software issue. Starliner "thought" it was not in orbit due to a mission time issue and continually was correcting the burn and used up too much fuel. Just saving the vehicle is a win in this situation.

USAF used to routinely do mid-air recoveries of parachute capsules with helos and C-130 aircraft.  It was very reliable and not exceptionally difficult for the aircrews to accomplish, especially since they had a special unit dedicated to air recoveries to keep  the experienced guys together for extended periods.  Also had specialized tracking equipment on the aircraft to help line up for the recovery.
